title: Closing the GAP's: Utilizing Good Agricultural Practices

tasks.task: Workers' hygiene improvements at a fresh produce farm
subtasks: Research worker hygiene regulations
Purchase toilet facilities (waterproof and easy to clean, hold plenty of toilet paper, paper towel dispenser, attached garbage can)
Install and promote hand washing stations outside, with large soap dispenser and single-use paper towels
Ensure hand-washing water collection system prevents contamination of crops
Purchase mandated crop protection agent storage units (fitted to reduce runoff, separate pesticides)
Implement and Maintain Calibration records for spray equipment
Research and Confirm past land use of new expansion property
Develop fertilizer and compost use policies (tested for pathogens, documented)
Test and document well water for safe use in crop production
Train workers on proper hygiene and safety procedures (hand washing, reporting illness)
Establish prevention and disposal protocols for contaminated produce
Maintain clean, sanitary packing areas and implement regular sanitization schedules
Set up temperature-controlled storage for post-harvest produce
Implement a traceability system for product tracking and recall

tasks.task: Improvement of farm Water systems for compliance with Good Agricultural Practices
subtasks: Water sources safety assessment (Check stream and wells for contamination)
Develop water testing and treatment policies
Install water purification or filtration systems if necessary
Hire and coordinate with a private GAP (Good Agricultural Practices) consultant
Attend and follow agricultural advisory program meetings and trainings
Stay current on new regulations and industry best practices Attending educational events and workshops

tasks.task: Documentation and Implement Good Agricultural Practices (GAP)
subtasks: Maintain detailed records of all farm activities (pesticide application, water testing, worker hygiene, etc.)
Create written policies for each aspect of GAP compliance
Schedule regular equipment inspections and maintenance
Update and educate workers on updated GAP procedures
Document the use of certified compost and soil amendments
Adhere to official harvest intervals and record adherence
Labels produce boxes with tracking information for traceability
Conduct regular cold room maintenance to ensure post-harvest quality.

tasks.task: Contractual review and transportation standards for new client fulfillment
subtasks: Confirm transportation requirements with the new buyer (Russell C. U.)
Obtain a pre-shipment checklist from a reliable shipper (Dean's advice)
Ensure hired shippers meet cleanliness and temperature control standards before use.
